alert.note: Alert for Genesee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 3:59PM EDT until August 03 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Genesee County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 358 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Flushing to near Lennon to near Perry, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Flushing, Clio, Mount Morris, Gaines and Beecher around 405 PM EDT. Flint, Swartz Creek and Crossroads Village around 410 PM EDT. Burton around 415 PM EDT. Davison, Otisville, Otter Lake and Lake Fenton around 420 PM EDT. Grand Blanc and Linden around 425 PM EDT. Fenton and Goodrich around 430 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Atlas, Thetford Township, Argentine, Rankin and Genesee. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
